description: This course is a philosophical inquiry into the core commitments of Christian theism in
the context of other world religions and naturalism.  Central themes include beliefs
about the existence and nature of God, the doctrines of the trinity and incarnation,
redemption and ritual, human free will and responsibility, revelation and reason,
religious experience, the problem of evil, different views of life after death, miracles
and historical inquiry, and religious pluralism. Offered annually.
